definition: to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
Ein Gespenst geht um in Europa./the opening sentence of Marx and Engels' "Communist Manifesto"
pinyin: Yi1 ge4 you1 ling2 zai4 Ou1 zhou1 you2 dang4

sentences.english: So in the interest of helping out the next generation of thieves, I'm going to offer you a few pointers.
sentences.chinese: 所以，爲了有助於下一代遊蕩者們，我準備教你幾招。

sentences.english: We found people wandering like ghosts through the ruins .
sentences.chinese: 孤魂野鬼一樣的人們在廢墟里遊蕩。

sentences.english: People walked through the streets aimlessly with nowhere to go, carrying the few bags and possessions they had left.
sentences.chinese: 人們帶着僅剩的財物包裹漫無目的遊蕩。

sentences.english: We need to cough up the goop and not let it just hang out in the back of the throat.).
sentences.chinese: 我們需要這種糊狀物質，不讓他在咽喉裏遊蕩。

sentences.english: On average throughout all the quarter-million responses, minds were wandering 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在25萬迴應中，平均下來思緒47%的時間在遊蕩。

sentences.english: Christlike vagrant wanders through a perverse and grotesque land filled with religious and sacrilegious imagery.
sentences.chinese: 像督流浪滿宗教瀆聖象異墮落遊蕩。

sentences.english: All love to be out by the light of the moon.
sentences.chinese: 它們都愛在月光下出來遊蕩。

sentences.english: When it was time for his appointment he drifted uptown to the club entrance.
sentences.chinese: 快到約會的時間，他遊遊蕩蕩地向夜總會的大門走去。

sentences.english: Drunken youths hang around outside looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 喝醉的年輕人在街頭遊蕩，酗酒滋事。

sentences.english: But stop and loiter all the time, to sing it in extatic songs.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾懶了遊蕩而已，哼着歌曲說說夢囈。

sentences.english: And there would be some strange people hanging out.
sentences.chinese: 會有一些奇奇怪怪的人在那裏遊蕩。

sentences.english: And I am told that it is haunted by the Ghost of Might-have-Been.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說這棟房子裏遊蕩着一個叫做“沒準”的鬼魂。

sentences.english: He also walked the streets by himself, observing and thinking.
sentences.chinese: 他也會一個人遊蕩在街頭，一邊觀察和思考。

sentences.english: The meteor has unleashed vicious alien creatures who roam the island in search of prey.
sentences.chinese: 流星釋放出的邪惡外星生物遊蕩在小島上找尋食物。

sentences.english: They love to swing from tree to tree.
Is there a sense of relief not walking around with Battlestar secrets anymore?
sentences.chinese: 不再隨神祕的太空堡壘四處遊蕩是否有一種解脫感呢？

definition: to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
